notes: First generation Golf sold as Rabbit in North America (A1 platform). 1.5L or 1.6L gasoline, plus diesel option. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as 2-door or 4-door. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Golf article, January 2025 revision.

First generation sport coupe on A1 platform. 1.5L or 1.6L four-cylinder. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. 3-door liftback coupe design. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Scirocco article, January 2025 revision.

North American name for Passat B1. 1.5L or 1.6L gasoline, plus diesel option. FWD. Manual or automatic transmission. Available as sedan or wagon. Diesel requires diesel service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Passat article, January 2025 revision.

Classic Beetle continued through 1970s in North America. 1.6L air-cooled flat-four. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Beetle article, January 2025 revision.

Super Beetle variant with MacPherson strut front suspension and curved windshield. 1.6L air-cooled flat-four. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Beetle article, January 2025 revision.

Type 2 T2 generation van. Air-cooled flat-four engines. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Available in passenger, cargo, and camper configurations. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Type 2 article, January 2025 revision.

Military-inspired utility vehicle. 1.6L air-cooled flat-four. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Convertible soft top and removable doors. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Type 181 article, January 2025 revision.

Stylish coupe based on Beetle platform. 1.6L air-cooled flat-four. Rear-engine RWD. Manual transmission only. Available as coupe or convertible. Classic air-cooled design requires specialized vintage service knowledge. Data sourced from Wikipedia Volkswagen Karmann Ghia article, January 2025 revision.
